description.narrative: Community demand for sustainable safe drinking water sources is improved and met

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Community demand for sustainable safe drinking water sources is improved and met

description.narrative: UNICEF interventions in 2019 have provided new access to safe and sustainable drinking water to more than 89,900 people against a target of 43,000, giving a total of 747,619 since 2015. UNICEF's headline achievement: the inauguration of the 180km Ampotaka pipeline powered by solar energy in the south provides sustainable access to water for 35,000 people affected by chronic drought and impacted by climate change. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of sustainability checks conducted with independent third party with related management response

Number of people living in water safe communities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of people living in water climate resilient communities in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
